etomica.species

Class SpeciesSpheresHetero

  • java.lang.Object
    • etomica.species.Species
      • etomica.species.SpeciesSpheresHetero
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ISpecies, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SpeciesAlkane, SpeciesAlkaneThiol

    public class SpeciesSpheresHetero
extends Species
    Species in which molecules are made of arbitrary number of atoms, with each atom have a given atom type. Atoms of a given type are grouped together. The number of each type can be give explicitly or as a fraction of the total.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • makeLeafAtom

      • getNumComponents

        public int getNumComponents()

      • setNumberFraction

        public void setNumberFraction(double[] newNumberFraction)
        Sets the number fraction of each child atom type made by this factory. The number of child atoms for each type is calculated from the number fraction for that type and the total number of child atoms. The number fractions normalized and the number of children is calculated in order of increasing number fraction.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if childFactory.length != childCount.length if any number fraction is <0 or >1 if all number fractions=0

      • getNumberFraction

        public double[] getNumberFraction()
        Returns the number fraction of each child type created by this factory.

      • setChildCount

        public void setChildCount(int[] newChildCount)
        Directly sets the number of child atoms of each type created by this factory. Invoking this method also sets numberFraction and totalChildCount based on the given parameters.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if childFactory.length != childCount.length if any childCount is < 0

      • getChildCount

        public int[] getChildCount()
        Returns the number of child atoms of each type created by this factory.

      • setChildTypes

        public void setChildTypes(IAtomType[] newchildTypes)
        Sets the factories that make the child atoms of this factory's atom. If the number of factories changes, the number fractions are set so that there is an equal amount of each child. The caller is responsible for ensuring that the AtomTypes for the child factories are children of this AtomFactory's AtomType.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if newChildFactory is an empty array

      • addChildType

        public void addChildType(IAtomType newLeafType)
        Adds the given factory as a child of this factory. The caller is responsible for ensuring that the AtomType for the child factory is a child of this AtomFactory's AtomType.
        Overrides:
        addChildType in class Species

      • removeChildType

        public void removeChildType(IAtomType oldLeafType)
        Removes the given factory as a child of this factory. The caller is responsible for removing the AtomType for the child factory from its parent AtomType.
        Overrides:
        removeChildType in class Species

      • setTotalChildren

        public void setTotalChildren(int numChildren)
        Sets the total number of child atoms created by this factory. The number of each atom type is recalculated based on the previous number fractions.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if numChildren < 0

      • getNumLeafAtoms

        public int getNumLeafAtoms()
